description: - Style Guide ---
Icosahedron Quest Description Style Guide.
The title of the quest should be put as a /b/Heading 1/b/, with dashes as seen above. Text should be spaced one space down from the title.
> text

/b/Blue/b/ and /6/Orange/6/ highlighted text is used to /6/highlight important information/6/. Generaly /b/Blue/b/ is used for /b/Item Names/b/. /6/Orange/6/ is used for /6/Processes/6/. Highlighted item names or other objects should be capitalized.
/c/Red/c/ can rarely be used for important information that relates to some sort of danger.
> /6/Smelting/6/ a /b/Raw Porkchop/b/ will give you a /b/Cooked Porkchop/b/.
Sub Headers
Sub headers, similar to the title, should have a space below and above them. They are a /b/Heading 2/b/.

> /

- Sub Header ---
> text
Generally there should be no need for sub headers in regular quests. They should be focused on a single topic and not need to be sectioned.
Quest backgrounds discribe what kind of quest it is.
Regular squares are for normal quests.
Hexagons are for informational quests, that have no tasks or rewards but tell useful information.
Diamonds are for milestone quests. These usually unlock a lot of new stuff.
Gears are the end of a section. These quests are a dependency for a quest in a diffrent section.
Tasks are embedded before a /b/Horizontal Line/b/ (hr/) at the end of the description. No spacing is required.
<hr/>
<task task="test" quest="Style Guide"/>
<hr/>
Another rank is placed after the task, if a reward is present in the quest. Some text can go here to describe the reward.
<reward reward="welcomelog" quest="Planetfall"/>
Text shouldn't be placed here, but there is text in the /b/Planetfall/b/ quest to serve as next steps.
